results.title: Sunday by the sea
results.creator_credit: Leon Clore, Harlequin Productions and Anthony Simmons
results.brief_description: Watching a typical day at the Brighton seaside, we see how the Londoner enjoys himself on one of his favourite excursions. Ballads made famous in music halls take the place of commentary. Photography by Walter Lassally. (Awards: Grand Prix, Venice)

results.title: Sunday
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Chris Backhouse
results.brief_description: A clay animated short film where two gentlemen transform their lounge room into a ballet stage. While one plays the harp, the other one dons a tutu and dances to Beethoven’s “Fur Elise”. This simple Australian short is delightful and mischievous.

results.title: Sunbury
results.creator_credit: John Dixon and Cambridge Film Production
results.brief_description: The Sunbury Music Festival, held each Australia Day between 1972 and 1975 holds fond memories for the 35,000 plus people who attended. This video shows highlights of the first festival in 1972 and captures the excitement of a festival which showcased Australian Rock music and provides a document of Australian society in the seventies.

results.title: Sun, wind and wood
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Edward Le Lorrain, Margaret Pettigrew, Kathleen Shannon and Dorothy Todd Henaut
results.brief_description: There are people who are fighting the high cost of energy by devising ingenious ways to use sun, wind and wood. This film illustrates the nature of these experiments, one of which is the Ark, a bio-shelter that, using natural systems only, provides housing, heat, food and electricity for a family.

results.title: Sun, surf and sand
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia, Annice Vass and Gillian Reeves
results.brief_description: This compilation of Newsreels celebrates 40 years of Australian beach culture from 1931-1975. Highlights include: Neck-to-knee and bikini fashions; women’s and men’s surf-lifesaving carnivals; bathing beauty competitions; Beach activities; Sydney to Hobart yacht race (1958); Iron man races, water skiing, skin diving and surf boat marathons. The footage is taken from original newsreel prints, so the quality may vary depending upon the quality of the original.
results.creator_credit_for_label: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia, Annice Vass and Gillian Reeves

results.title: Sun, sand and sea
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Crossroads of the world: a study of North Africa and the Middle East”
This film sets the scene for the series, reviewing the cultural background of the North Africa-Middle East region as well as its geography. Ity traces the origins of the Islamic peoples, discusses Mahomet and his teachings, and shows the extent of the Arab conquest and its contribution to our arts, science and technology. The film closes with the decline of Islam, its retreat and isolation from the world through many centuries.

results.title: Sun pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Pioneers of photography”.
Hippolyte Boyard in Paris, Hill and Adamson in Edinburgh, raised photography to the level of art. Extracts of Boyard’s 1840’s record of Paris are shown along with the pictures of Edinburgh created by these pioneer photographers.

results.title: Sun on the stubble
results.creator_credit: Terry Jennings, FA, ABC-TV (Australia), AFFC, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and Robert Marchand
results.brief_description: Bruno Gunter, a 14 year-old boy from a German immigrant family grows up on a wheat farm in South Australia during the 1930’s. Even though his father is strict and an advocate of hard work, Bruno finds plenty of mischief and adventure. He has to deal with a new school teacher, the feud between Jack Ryan and Hermann Heinz as well as coping with his family. This adaptation of Thiele’s novels will delight the family as a byegone era is vividly recreated and a period of Australia’s history and heritage is bought to life. Starring Jamie Croft as Bruno, Christian Kohlund as his father and Susan Lyons as his mother. Based on four novels written by Colin Thiele.
